result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Gibson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

reflects 07-28-16 Correction adding restitutuion to this case

Request and Order to Correct Clerical Erro in Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.

Error in Judgment of Conviction: 
No restitution is ordered on 15CM986, but is referenced to be paid as a conditon of probation on 12CM4823.

Correction: 
On case 15CM986: The court orders restitution i the amount of $1,525.00 paid to J.K., to be paid as a condition of probation in case #12CM4823
On case 12CM4823: The court orders restitution in 15CM986 to be paid as a condition of Probation in this case.
returned to court for clarification on the payment of restitution in this case and in case 12CM4823

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael M Gibson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Michael M Gibson in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 43 dayS time served.  

Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges by 07-18-2018 or serve 15 days in the House of Corrections.  

Court will consider expungment if restitution is paid in full in Case 12CM4823 and no new arrests.
  
 received and filed on  6-30-16.
Notice of Right to Seek Post conviction Relief
Petrial Incarceration Credit.

received and filed on 7-18-2016
Victim Witness Impact Statement.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47

Defendant Michael M Gibson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael M Gibson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Michael M Gibson in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informs the court that they believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.    Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 47. Same bail.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael M Gibson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael M Gibson in custody.  Gale Graham Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant requesting expungement.
No reply from defendant or surety.  vp

Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.
 Court ordered Dr.  Collins  be appointed to examine the defendant out of custody and scheduled an appointment on 1-29-16 at 8:30 for an evaluation on   competency pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.14(2).
Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 47

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 2528 W Wells St.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael M Gibson in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Siefert, BR. 47.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Br. 47.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/26/15 @ 1:30pm
